channel.title: Firefox- Access Denied
channel.description:
![](upload://yOOxZSdPo31FQoMZGuQTxD3Wtva.png)
This just occured. Only happens in Firefox. Is this just a normal update or something? Am I using a security risk version of FF that Cloudflare has decided to block?

item.title: Firefox- Access Denied
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
You or spyware powered by your machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox- Access Denied
item.dc:creator: Hubicorn
item.description:
gibbelin:

I got this message too. I didn’t read the whole thing though, so I just figured my boss blocked it because I was screwing off at work.

We just switched to a CDN service called CloudFlare. This allows us to block threats, proxy surfing, trolls, and spammers at a DNS level and challenge all visitors that have exhibited threatening behavior within the last 14 days. The website loads around 75% faster as well. Tonight I am going to edit a bunch of settings within CloudFlare to ensure people dont get accidentally flagged. If you have been blocked, this most likely means you’ve been doing something dirty on another CloudFlare powered service.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox- Access Denied
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Use a different DNS server

208.67.222.222

Delete

C:\Users_\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles__.default

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox- Access Denied
item.dc:creator: Greenhorn
item.description:
Works fine for me

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox- Access Denied
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
well there are 3 possibilities. (that i can see)

  1. You were banned from another CloudFlare site.

  2. You happened to be super luckey/unluckey and the hash of your browser signiture is the exact same as a blocked one.

  3. Some sort of CloudFlare bug.

Try updating, clearing the cache or reinstalling FF and it should get around the block.

Read full topic
